comments.body: Thanks for this! In the hindsight 2020 it makes sense that `.asJava` that I added in https://github.com/sbt/zinc/pull/799 was suboptimal.

Teamwork!

In the absence of automated performance testing, it seems inevitable that this kind of performance regression might occur. I wouldn't have noticed the regression were it not for https://github.com/eatkins/scala-build-watch-performance. That being said, a useful heuristic that I try to follow is to avoid copying data if at all possible. It's often hard to tell in isolation whether or not copying will impact performance. I also try to practice the boy scout rule of leaving things better than I found them.
